review: I got this when Amazon was offering their "order early and save 5 bucks" promotion.  It came in a nice box with HDMI dongle, HDMI extender, USB power cable/adapter, and remote.  At first, I opted to use my Chromecast over the firestick because the Chromecast offered more functionality in terms of direct screen mirroring of my android device to the TV, but they have since patched it and now I can mirror my phone to my TV no problem.  The good thing about this device is that it can bring a TV out of "powered OFF" mode.  Meaning, if your tv is OFF, and you press a button on the firestick remote, or you send a signal to start broadcasting to the firestick, the TV will turn on!  The Chromecast does not have this functionality as of yet.  I tried using the added features of games and all of the other stuff, but my interest in them has dwindled.  I only use this for netflix and phone screen mirroring.Complaints:  The only complaint I have about this vs the Chromecast is that every time I log onto the netflix with the Firestick, I have to select the netflix user that's watching.  So if I triggered the firestick to stream a video from netflix via my phone, I would have to open up the firestick remote app and select the netflix user before I can watch the video.  A work around would be just to keep sending the signal to play from the netflix app and eventually it will play the video, but Chromecast doesn't give me this problem.All in all, it does what I need it to do.  The remote is nice in that I don't have to use my phone to control the device, but because of the annoyance of asking which user is using the netflix app bumped it down 1 star.
